content:
Sure, here are two more noodle recipes that use different types of nuts and seeds:

1. Cashew Curry Noodles:
- Cook your preferred noodles according to package instructions and drain.
- In a pan, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and chopped serrano pepper in a tablespoon of coconut oil until the onions are translucent.
- Add a tablespoon of curry powder and a can of unsweetened coconut milk to the pan and stir until combined.
- Add cooked noodles, sliced bell peppers, and sliced zucchini to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
- Turn off the heat and add a handful of cashews.
- Serve and garnish with chopped cilantro and a sprinkle of red pepper flakes.

2. Sunflower Pesto Noodles:
- Cook your preferred noodles according to package instructions and drain.
- In a food processor, blend together 1 cup of fresh basil, ⅔ cup of roasted and unsalted sunflower seeds, 1 clove of garlic, ½ cup of olive oil, and a pinch of salt until smooth.
- Toss the cooked noodles with the pesto and add sliced cherry tomatoes, steamed broccoli florets, and sliced black olives.
- Serve and garnish with grated Parmesan cheese.

Hope you enjoy these recipes too!
